page.title: 10PASTORAL CARE - EGMERE AREA
page.content: Seven-eighths of the area is within the{Parish of Wells-next-the-Sea}, administered by the Rev. W. Sayer. The rest is in the{South Creake Living}of Rev. L.Gedge. Inhabitants go to church either in Wells - five miles distant - or at Waterden Church, just outside the area. Most of the inhabitants say they are{Church of England}and feel that visits from their priests are welcome.{Rural clergymen}have to travel often to administer their parishes. Their work includes visits to the sick and the taking of Mass to the home of any incapable of attending church. Historically, in 1900 an ex-railway carriage provided a place to worship. One man tells that he was christened in it. Later the Earl of Leicester built the Egmere Institute which was used for worship. This has since ceased.
